record.title: FREE FLOW OF INFORMATION ACT OF 2007--MOTION TO PROCEED
record.narrative:
FREE FLOW OF INFORMATION ACT OF 2007--MOTION TO PROCEED -- (Senate - July 28, 2008)

[Page: S7554]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I move to proceed to Calendar No. 434, S. 2035, the Free Flow of Information Act--this is the media shield bill--and I send a cloture motion to the desk. In fact, it is at the desk.

record.chair: The cloture motion having been presented under rule XXII, the Chair directs the clerk to read the motion.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

We, the undersigned Senators, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, hereby move to bring to a close debate on the motion to proceed to Calendar No. 434, S. 2035, the Free Flow of Information Act.
record.chair: By unanimous consent the mandatory quorum call has been waived.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now withdraw the motion to proceed.
